comments:
Eclipse build I20050426-1700.

Tried running eclipse on Windows ME.
3.1 didn't start (stack trace pasted below).
3.0 didn't start either (no stack trace, but probably same error).
2.1.3 runs fine.

Here's the stack trace for the 3.1 failure. It was written to a numbered .log 
file in the C:\WINDOWS\.eclipse\configuration directory. Note that 3.0 fails 
with a similar dialog message ("Could not find framework") however there is no 
log written when 3.0 fails.

!SESSION Fri Apr 29 17:29:35 EDT 2005 ------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Apr 29, 2005 17:29:35.420
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not find framework
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:624)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:266)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:951)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:935)

I'm a bit surprised since eclipse 3.0 is running on NT and 98 (McQ and I tested that before 3.0 shipped).
Where do we have a Win ME box?

Note I don't think Windows ME belongs to the set of supported platforms.

I have 3 partitions on my Windows box: XP, 2K, ME.
Drop by and we can boot into ME.

I was surprised also - I reported it to make sure that 98 was ok.
You are right that ME isn't in the supported list, but let's have a quick look 
to see if it is something simple.

The startup code does some massaging of the install area to find the plugins
folder. One of the check consists in checking if a string ends up with ".jar".
On ME, the file being checked ends up with ".JAR", therefore it does not matched
and then we fail finding the plugins folder.

This is probably not specific to ME, but the FAT16/32 file system on the 
partition. You could require that users have a real file system ;-)

Traveling back in time, I found similar issues in bug #19046.
It seems that when doing sharing of install is one of the main reasons for troubles.
Given that we are talking of unsupported platforms, I'm releasing a fix that
helps this specific case.
CAR, please verify the fix on your ME machine.  Thanks.

Created an attachment (id=21276)
Startup.jar as it should be in the drop

To really recreate the condition of the bug, rename startup.jar in STARTUP.JAR
Eclipse M7 starts up fine on ME now. Thanks, Pascal!
